column1: The '''Birmingham Oratory''' is a Roman Catholic church in [[Birmingham]]
column2: England. It is used primarily by the Oratory of Saint Philip Neri
column3: a congregation of priests and lay-brothers. Because of its baroque design
column4: it is often called the "Little Rome in Birmingham".

column1: The church was constructed between 1907 and 1910 as a memorial to the Blessed John Henry Newman
column2: a prominent English cardinal who converted from Anglicanism to Catholicism.

column3: worshipped here for about seven years. [[Francis Xavier Morgan]]
column5: was a priest of the oratory.

column1: *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=emaY0BfA06o "JRR Tolkien and the Birmingham Oratory" YouTube video]
